newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ Solid Energy to barge coal exports to Australia.
newsitem.headline: NZ Solid Energy to barge coal exports to Australia.

text.p: Solid Energy New Zealand Ltd said on Wednesday that it would start to export coal by barge directly to Australia from Westport, on the west coast of South Island, from the middle of this year.

"This is another significant step in our export growth strategy of doubling exports from our west coast mines in the next three to five years," said John Ryan, Solid Energy's national services manager.
At present New Zealand's coal exports are moved by rail to the Port of Lyttelton, on the east coast of the South Island.
Coal that goes to Australia is blended with Australian coals for re-export.
Ryan told Reuters the coal to be barged from Westport would be lower-margin coal, for which the Lyttelton transport route was not proving cost-effective.

"At the moment it costs us as much to take the coal from our mine to the ship as it does to actually mine the coal. On the lower margin coal, that really doesn't allow us to have a sustainable long term business," he said.
